metadata.title: AKS Service Account Impersonation
metadata.description: Detects when a user impersonates a service account.

properties.description: Detects when a user impersonates a service account, which can be used for privilege escalation.
properties.query:
AzureDiagnostics
| where Category == "kube-audit"
| where TimeGenerated > ago(5m)
| extend log = parse_json(log_s)
| extend impersonatedUser = log.impersonatedUser
| extend user = log.user
| extend sourceIPs = log.sourceIPs
| extend verb = tostring(log.verb)
| extend objectRef = log.objectRef
| where isnotempty(impersonatedUser)
| extend
    ImpersonatedUsername = tostring(impersonatedUser.username),
    ImpersonatedGroups = tostring(impersonatedUser.groups),
    ActualUsername = tostring(user.username),
    ActualGroups = tostring(user.groups),
    SourceIP = tostring(sourceIPs[0]),
    Resource_Type = tostring(objectRef.resource),
    ResourceName = tostring(objectRef.name),
    Namespace = tostring(objectRef.namespace),
    Verb = verb,
    ClusterName = Resource
| where ImpersonatedUsername startswith "system:serviceaccount:"
| project
    TimeGenerated,
    ClusterName,
    ActualUsername,
    ImpersonatedUsername,
    ImpersonatedGroups,
    SourceIP,
    Verb,
    Resource_Type,
    ResourceName,
    Namespace
| summarize
    FirstSeen = min(TimeGenerated),
    LastSeen = max(TimeGenerated),
    ImpersonationCount = count(),
    ResourcesAccessed = make_set(strcat(Resource_Type, "/", ResourceName), 20),
    Verbs = make_set(Verb, 10)
    by ClusterName, ActualUsername, ImpersonatedUsername, SourceIP

alertDetailsOverride.alertDescriptionFormat: User '{{ActualUsername}}' impersonated service account '{{ImpersonatedUsername}}' from IP {{SourceIP}}. This is a high-risk privilege escalation technique.
